prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with rounded corners and edges** *Shape*: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The height is approximately twice the width. The length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side. *Dimensions*: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.285 units *Instructions*: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Start a new sketch on the XY plane. 3. Draw a rectangle by creating the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. Extrude the sketch by 0.285 units along the Z-axis. **Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object at the center of the rectangular prism** *Shape*: The CAD model consists of nine different views of a cylindrical object with varying heights, widths, and arrangements. The object has a flat top and bottom and may have holes or other features. The views show the object from various angles, including side, top, and bottom perspectives. The object is symmetrical along its central axis. *Dimensions*: - Length: 0.6313 units - Width: 0.6313 units - Height: 0.1275 units *Instructions*: 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0], and a translation vector of [0.0617, 0.0689, 0.285]. 2. Start a new sketch on the XY plane. 3. Draw 4 circles for each corner of the cylindrical object: - Circle 1: Center [0.1312, 0.1312], Radius: 0.1312 - Circle 2: Center [0.1312, 0.4934], Radius: 0.1312 - Circle 3: Center [0.5001, 0.1312], Radius: 0.1312 - Circle 4: Center [0.5001, 0.4934], Radius: 0.1312 4. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6313. 5. Extrude the sketch by 0.1275 units along the Z-axis. These instructions, following the provided "CAD Assembly JSON," should allow the junior CAD designer to generate an accurate CAD model of the three-dimensional rectangular prism with rounded corners and edges, as well as the cylindrical object at the center of the prism.</description>

This part is created using a single sketch and a single extrusion. 1. **Create a coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane** Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the newly created coordinate system. 3. **Create a rectangle in the sketch** Create a rectangle in the 2D sketch by creating four lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.75] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This rectangle forms a closed loop. 4. **Scale the 2D sketch** Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. 5. **Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same coordinate system. 6. **Extrude the scaled 3D sketch** Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.75 units, which is the height of the rectangular prism. The resulting part should have the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.75 units The extrusion depth parameters can be set to 0.75 for both the "towards normal" and "opposite normal" vectors as we don't require any additional extrusion in this example. The sketch scale factor should be set to 0.75 to apply the desired scaling.</description>
